page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: THE BLOCK IS A TYPICAL NORTH LONDON RURAL/SUBURBAN AREA IT IS CHARACTERISED BY ITS LEAFY GARDENS AND EXPENSIVE HOUSING.THE NORTHERN SECTOR OF THE BLOCK IS PART OF AN EXTENSIVE GREEN-BELT WHICH SEPARATES THE SOUTHERN BUILT-UP DISTRICT FROM THE OPEN COUNTRYSIDE AND LARGE PRIVATE GARDENS AND MANSIONS WHICH CONTINUE NORTHWARDS. THE AREA IS WELL SUPPLIED WITH OPEN SPACE FOR LEISURE ACTIVITIES TWO BUSY NORTH/SOUTH TRUNK ROADS,THE A1000 AND THE A111, SWEEP THROUGH THE BLOCK.THE A1000,A VERY LONG AND BUSY HIGH STREET,IS CROWDED WITH COMMERCIAL BUILDINGS IT IS USUALLY THRONGED WITH SHOPPERS.A TWICE WEEKLY MARKET IS HELD JUST OFF THE HIGH STREET ON WEDNESDAYS AND SATURDAYS.TWO LONDON TUBE LINES TERMINATE IN THE BLOCK AND THE LONDON TO SCOTLAND RAILWAY LINE RUNS THROUGH.
